title: Arnan's expense is 30% more than Vimal's expense and Vimal's expense is 10% less than Raman’s expense. If the Sum of their expenses, is Rs.6447, then what would be the Aman's expense? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends……! Let Raman expenses be ₹x. Vimal's expense is 10% less than Raman’s expense 10% of x = 10/100 of x = 0.10x Thus Vimal’s expenses will be x - 0.10x Arnan's expense is 30% more than Vimal's expense 30% of x - 0.10x = 30/100 × (x - 0.10x) = 0.30 (x - 0.10x) Arman's expenses will be (x - 0.10x) + 0.30 (x - 0.10x) If the Sum of their expenses, is Rs.6447, then what would be the Aman's expense. x + (x - 0.10x) + (x - 0.10x) + 0.30 (x - 0.10x) = 6447 x + x - 0.10x + 0.90x + 0.30 × 0.90x = 6447 x + x - 0.10x + 0.90x + 0.27x = 6447 3.17x - 0.10x = 6447 3.07x = 6447 x = 6447 /3.07 x = ₹2100 Thus Raman expenses will be ₹ 2100 Vimal’s expenses x - 0.10x = 2100 - 0.10 × 2100 = 2100 - 210 = ₹1890 Arnan's expenses = 30% more than Vimal's exoenses = 1890 + 0.30 × 1890 = 1890 + 567 Thus Arnan's expenses are ₹2457 Answer Arnan's expenses are ₹2457 Let us check for correctness of answer by taking the sum of derived expenses ₹2100 + ₹1890 + ₹2457 = ₹6447 Means answer is correct.
